g.text: Cargo Shipping Company
UC101-Import ships from a text file
UC102-Search details of a ship
UC103-Have the positional message temporally organized
and associated with the ships
UC104-Make a summary of the ship's movements
UC105-List for all the ships the MMSI, the total number
of movements, Travelled Distance and Delta Distance
UC106-Get the top-N ships with the most kilometres travelled
and their average speed
UC107-Get pairs of ships with routes with close departure/arrival
coordinates and with different Travelled Distance
UC108-Develop the data model required to support all the functionality and
to fulfill the purpose of the system to develop
UC109-Draft an SQL script to test whether the database verifies
all the data integrity restrictions that are required
to fulfil the purpose of the system and the business constraints of the UoD
UC110-Define the naming conventions to apply
when defining identifiers or writing SQL or PL/SQL code
UC111-Create a SQL script to load the database
with a minimum set of data sufficient to carry out data
integrity verification and functional testing
UC201-Import ports from a text file
UC202-Find the closest port of a ship given its CallSign, on a certain DateTime
UC203-Review the relational data model in view of the new user stories
so it can support all the requirements to fulfil the purpose of the system being developed
UC204-Know the current situation of a specific container being used to transport my goods
UC205-Get the list of containers to be offloaded in the next port,
including container identifier, type, position, and load.
UC206-Get the list of containers to be loaded in the next port,
including container identifier, type, and load.
UC207-Know how many cargo manifests I have transported during
a given year and the average number of containers per manifest
UC208-Know the occupancy rate (percentage) of a given ship for
a given cargo manifest. Occupancy rate is the ratio between
total number of containers in the ship coming from a given manifest and the
total capacity of the ship, i.e., the maximum number of containers the ship can load.
UC209-Know the occupancy rate of a given ship at a given moment.
UC210-Know which ships will be available on Monday next week and their location
Traffic Manager
Project Manager
Port Manager
Client
Ship Captain
